Ingredients.6: 4 small apples - peeled, cored, and cut into small cubes

Directions.1: Mix butter and cream cheese together in a bowl. Stir in flour until dough comes together and forms into a ball. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight.

Directions.2: Combine apples, sugar, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover; cook, stirring frequently, until apples are the consistency of chunky applesauce, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.

Directions.3: Remove dough from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.

Directions.4: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Directions.5: Divide dough into 10 pieces and roll into balls. Roll out each ball into a 3- to 4-inch circle with a rolling pin. Fill one side of the circle with apple filling. Moisten edges lightly with water. Fold dough over the filling and press edges together to seal.

Directions.6: Arrange empanadas on the prepared baking sheet.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven until dough is golden, about 15 minutes.
